intro: Didiciea cunninghamii, commonly known as the Cunningham's didiciea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is typically found in dry, open habitats such as woodlands and heathlands. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
